quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question: The output of executing string.ascii_letters can also be achieved by:
quiz.reason: Execute in shell and check.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question: What arithmetic operators cannot be used with strings?
quiz.reason: + is used to concatenate and * is used to multiply strings.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question: Given a string example=”hello” what is the output of example.count(‘l’)?
quiz.reason: l occurs twice in hello.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question: To concatenate two strings to a third what statements are applicable?
quiz.reason: __add__ is another method that can be used for concatenation.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question: The format function, when applied on a string returns ___________
quiz.reason: Format function returns a string.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question: What will be the output of the “hello” +1+2+3?
quiz.reason: Cannot concatenate str and int objects.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question: What will be displayed by print(ord(‘b’) – ord(‘a’))?
quiz.reason: ASCII value of b is one more than a. Hence the output of this code is 98-97, which is equal to 1.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question: Say s=”hello” what will be the return value of type(s)?
quiz.reason: str is used to represent strings in python.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question: What is “Hello”.replace(“l”, “e”)?
quiz.reason: Execute in shell to verify.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question: To retrieve the character at index 3 from string s=”Hello” what command do we execute (multiple answers allowed)?
quiz.reason: Execute in shell to verify.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question: If a class defines the __str__(self) method, for an object obj for the class, you can use which command to invoke the __str__ method.
quiz.reason: Execute in shell to verify.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question: To check whether string s1 contains another string s2, use ________
quiz.reason: s2 in s1 works in the same way as calling the special function __contains__ .

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question: Suppose i is 5 and j is 4, i + j is same as ________
quiz.reason: Execute in shell to verify.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question: What function do you use to read a string?
quiz.reason: Execute in shell to verify.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question: Suppose x is 345.3546, what is format(x, “10.3f”) (_ indicates space).
quiz.reason: Execute in the shell to verify.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 >>>print (r“hello“)

options.c: the letter r and then hello

quiz.reason:
When prefixed with the letter ‘r’ or ‘R’ a string literal becomes a raw string and the escape sequences such as 
 are not converted.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python statement?
 >>>print('new' 'line')
quiz.reason: String literal separated by whitespace are allowed. They are concatenated.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(0xA + 0xB + 0xC)
quiz.reason: 0xA and 0xB and 0xC are hexadecimal integer literals representing the decimal values 10, 11 and 12 respectively. There sum is 33.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python statement?
 >>>chr(ord(‘A’))
quiz.reason: Execute in shell to verify.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python statement?
 >>>print(chr(ord(‘b’)+1))
quiz.reason: Execute in the shell to verify.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(“xyyzxyzxzxyy“.count(‘yy’))
quiz.reason: Counts the number of times the substring ‘yy’ is present in the given string.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(“xyyzxyzxzxyy”.count(‘yy’, 1))
quiz.reason: Counts the number of times the substring ‘yy’ is present in the given string, starting from position 1.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(”xyyzxyzxzxyy”.count(‘yy’, 2))
quiz.reason: An error will not occur if the end value is greater than the length of the string itself.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(“xyyzxyzxzxyy“.count(‘xyy’, 2, 11))
quiz.reason: Counts the number of times the substring ‘xyy’ is present in the given string, starting from position 2 and ending at position 11.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(“xyyzxyzxzxyy”.count(‘xyy’, -10, -1))
quiz.reason: Counts the number of times the substring ‘xyy’ is present in the given string, starting from position 2 and ending at position 11.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 
 print(‘abc’.encode())
quiz.reason: A bytes object is returned by encode.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(“xyyzxyzxzxyy”.endswith(“xyy”))
quiz.reason: The function returns True if the given string ends with the specified substring.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(“xyyzxyzxzxyy”.endswith(“xyy”, 0, 2))
quiz.reason: The function returns False if the given string does not end with the specified substring.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(u201Cabc DEF”.capitalize())
quiz.reason: The first letter of the string is converted to uppercase and the others are converted to lowercase.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(“abc. DEF”.capitalize())
quiz.reason: The first letter of the string is converted to uppercase and the others are converted to lowercase.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(“abcdef“.center())
quiz.reason: The function center() takes at least one parameter.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(“abcdef”.center(0))
quiz.reason: The entire string is printed when the argument passed to center() is less than the length of the string.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(‘*’, “abcdef”.center(7), ‘*’)
quiz.reason: Padding is done towards the left-hand-side first when the final string is of odd length. Extra spaces are present since we haven’t overridden the value of sep.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(‘*’, “abcdef”.center(7), ‘*’, sep=‘’)
quiz.reason: Padding is done towards the left-hand-side first when the final string is of odd length.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(‘*’, “abcde”.center(6), ‘*’, sep=‘’)
quiz.reason: Padding is done towards the right-hand-side first when the final string is of even length.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(“abcdef“.center(7, 1))
quiz.reason: TypeError, the fill character must be a character, not an int.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(“abcdef“.center(7, ‘1’))
quiz.reason: The character ‘1’ is used for padding instead of a space.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(“abcdef“.center(10, ‘12’))
quiz.reason: The fill character must be exactly one character long.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(“abcdef”.find(“cd”))
quiz.reason: The first position in the given string at which the substring can be found is returned.

quiz.subject: Python
quiz.question:
What will be the output of the following Python code?
 print(“ccdcddcd”.find(“c”))
quiz.reason: The first position in the given string at which the substring can be found is returned.
